title: Compiler panic with generic-typed nested closures

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
Discovered a compiler panic, thought it might relate to [#58840](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/58840), but was told to post a new issue.

In minimizing, it seems the generic types are required to trigger the panic, I was unable to reproduce when inlining t7p or t8n.

---
This code panics on 1.33 - 1.35, but does not panic on 1.32 ([playpen](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=efd0145db3f4a4d7df9654319309e076)):

```rust
fn t7p<A,B,C>( f:impl Fn(B) -> C, g:impl Fn(A) -> B ) -> impl Fn(A) -> C
{
  move |a:A| -> C { f(g(a)) }
}

fn t8n<A,B,C>( f:impl Fn(A) -> B, g:impl Fn(A) -> C ) -> impl Fn(A) -> (B,C)
  where
    A: Copy
{
  move |a:A| -> (B,C) {
    let b = a;
    let fa = f(a);
    let ga = g(b);
    (fa, ga)
  }
}

fn main() {

  let f = |(_,_)| {  };
  let g = |(a,_)| { a };
  let t7 = |env| { |a| { |b| {  t7p(f, g)(((env,a),b))  }}};
  let t8 = t8n(t7, t7p(f, g));
}
```
On 1.32:
```
error[E0277]: expected a `std::ops::Fn<(_,)>` closure, found `impl std::ops::Fn<(((_, _), _),)>`
  --> src/main.rs:32:12
   |
32 |   let t8 = pair_panic(t7, o_panic(f, g));
   |            ^^^^^^^^^^ expected an `Fn<(_,)>` closure, found `impl std::ops::Fn<(((_, _), _),)>`
   |
   = help: the trait `std::ops::Fn<(_,)>` is not implemented for `impl std::ops::Fn<(((_, _), _),)>`
note: required by `pair_panic`
  --> src/main.rs:9:1
   |
9  | / fn pair_panic<A,B,C>( f:impl Fn(A) -> B, g:impl Fn(A) -> C ) -> impl Fn(A) -> (B,C)
10 | |   where
11 | |     A: Copy
12 | | {
...  |
18 | |   }
19 | | }
   | |_^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: Could not compile `panic`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

On 1.35 nightly:
```

note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace

   2: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}

  26: rustc::ty::context::GlobalCtxt::enter_local

#0 [typeck_tables_of] processing `main`
#1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies
#2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: rustc 1.35.0-nightly (fbd34efb3 2019-03-26) running on x86_64-apple-darwin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
error: Could not compile `rust`.
To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

--Bryan
